intro: Grammitis procera, commonly known as the giant wall fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its tall, upright fronds that can reach up to 2 meters in height, making it one of the largest ferns in the genus Grammitis. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical rainforests and along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with a distinctive, elongated shape and a leathery texture. Grammitis procera is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained, acidic soil.
